meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a liquid crystal phase in which the molecules are arranged in layers.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the smectic structure of the liquid crystal under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The smectic arrangement of molecules in the liquid crystal allows for unique optical properties.
meanings.sent3: The smectic layers in the liquid crystal were so organized, they looked like a perfectly stacked deck of cards.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like the smectic layers, each one neatly stacked upon the other.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid picture of the smectic pattern, capturing the beauty of layered molecules.

meanings.definition: A substance that exhibits smectic properties.
meanings.sent1: The new material discovered in the lab turned out to be a smectic with fascinating properties.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the smectic to understand its unique behavior in different conditions.
meanings.sent3: The smectic on the lab shelf seemed to have a mischievous glint, as if it knew its own secrets.
meanings.sent4: The smectic was a hidden gem in the world of materials, waiting to be fully explored.
meanings.sent5: The properties of the smectic substance were as intriguing as a treasure map, leading to new discoveries.
